awd_titl_txt: Travel: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2023 IEEE International Conference on Smart Computing
awd_abstract_narration:
The Ninth IEEE International Conference on Smart Computing (SMARTCOMP 2023) will be held in Nashville, TN, USA on June 26-30, 2023.  IEEE SMARTCOMP 2023 conference offers a valuable opportunity to present cutting-edge computing and engineering research results, to learn about the state-of-the-art in smart and connected computing and communities, and to train US-based undergraduate, master’s, doctoral, and post-doctoral students (from computer science and engineering disciplines) through the main conference and other associated events (e.g., student forum, workshops, demo, posters, and industry sessions). SMARTCOMP 23 will be the first in-person meeting since the pandemic and as such will facilitate research collaborations in this important research space.This grant will support the travel of 20 US-based students to attend the IEEE SMARTCOMP 2023 conference in-person in Nashville, TN, USA.  
 
SMARTCOMP is the premier conference on smart computing that is emerging as an important multidisciplinary area. Smart Computing can be broadly classified into two major topics: (1) how to design and build smart computing and service systems, and (2) how to use computing and engineering technology for resource sustainability to improve the human experience. Applications of smart computing span trans-disciplinary boundaries such as transportation, energy, sustainability, structural health, environmental protection, healthcare, security, and so on. Advancements in wireless mobile communications, nanotechnology, cyber-physical systems (CPS), internet of things (IoT), sensor networking, cognitive/intelligent systems, control theory, wisdom computing, cloud computing, pervasive computing, and social computing are bringing smart computing and smart service systems to a newer dimension and improving mankind’s quality of life and living experience.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The 9th IEEE International Conference on Smart Computing (SMARTCOMP) awarded NSF student travel grants to 20 outstanding students from 13 different U.S.-based institutions. These students were selected from a competitive pool of 38 applicants through a meticulous committee-based review process. The awardees include both graduate (Ph.D./Master) and undergraduate students. Eleven of the award recipients are female students. One awardee is African American, and two awardees are Latino or Hispanic. All recipients possess excellent academic records and are actively engaged in cutting-edge research in the field of smart computing.


IEEE SMARTCOMP is the premier conference on smart computing. Smart computing is a multidisciplinary domain based on the synergistic influence of advances in sensor-based technologies, Internet of Things, cyber-physical systems, edge computing, big data analytics, machine learning, cognitive computing, and artificial intelligence. Participating in IEEE SMARTCOMP offers substantial benefits for students' research and career development. The conference serves as a unique platform where students can present their research findings, engage in intellectual discussions during panel and keynote sessions, and gain valuable insights through a variety of technical sessions. Moreover, it provides an excellent opportunity for students to interact with both their peers and established researchers, thereby enriching their academic and professional networks.


The NSF student travel award significantly enhances the participation of U.S.-based graduate students at IEEE SMARTCOMP. This support is particularly crucial for students who might not otherwise have the financial means to attend such a prestigious event. By facilitating their attendance, the award ensures that a diverse group of talented students can benefit from the rich learning experiences and professional development opportunities offered by the conference. Overall, these travel grants play a vital role in promoting the advancement of smart computing research and nurturing the next generation of researchers in this field.

 

 


Last Modified: 07/05/2024
Modified by: Meiyi Ma
